verses.verse: <S%H376>He<s%>, that being often <S%H8433>reproved<s%> <S%H7185>hardens<s%> his <S%H6203>neck<s%>, shall <S%H6621>suddenly<s%> be <S%H7665>destroyed<s%>, and that without <S%H4832>remedy<s%>.

When the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> are in <S%H7235>authority<s%>, the <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H8055>rejoice<s%>: but when the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> bears <S%H4910>rule<s%>, the <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H584>mourn<s%>.

<S%H376>Whoever<s%> <S%H157>loves<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> <S%H8055>rejoices<s%> his <S%H1>father<s%>: but he that keeps <S%H7462>company<s%> with <S%H2181>harlots<s%> <S%H6>spends<s%> his <S%H1952>substance<s%>.
The <S%H4428>king<s%> by <S%H4941>judgment<s%> <S%H5975>establishes<s%> the <S%H776>land<s%>: but <S%H376>he<s%> that receives <S%H8641>gifts<s%> overthrows <S%H2040>it<s%>.
A <S%H1397>man<s%> that <S%H2505>flatters<s%> his <S%H7453>neighbor<s%> <S%H6566>spreads<s%> a <S%H7568>net<s%> for his <S%H6471>feet<s%>.
In the <S%H6588>transgression<s%> of a <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> there is a <S%H4170>snare<s%>: but the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> does <S%H7442>sing<s%> and <S%H8056>rejoice<s%>.
The <S%H6662>righteous<s%> <S%H3045>considers<s%> the <S%H1779>cause<s%> of the <S%H1800>poor<s%>: but the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H995>regards<s%> not to know <S%H1847>it<s%>.
<S%H3944>Scornful<s%> <S%H582>men<s%> <S%H6315>bring<s%> a <S%H7151>city<s%> into a <S%H6315>snare<s%>: but <S%H2450>wise<s%> men turn <S%H7725>away<s%> <S%H639>wrath<s%>.
If a <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H8199>contends<s%> with a <S%H191>foolish<s%> <S%H376>man<s%>, whether he <S%H7264>rage<s%> or <S%H7832>laugh<s%>, there is no <S%H5183>rest<s%>.
The <S%H582>bloodthirsty<s%> <S%H8130>hate<s%> the <S%H8535>upright<s%>: but the <S%H3477>just<s%> <S%H1245>seek<s%> his <S%H5315>soul<s%>.
A <S%H3684>fool<s%> <S%H3318>utters<s%> all his <S%H7307>mind<s%>: but a <S%H2450>wise<s%> man <S%H7623>keeps<s%> it in until <S%H268>afterwards<s%>.
If a <S%H4910>ruler<s%> <S%H7181>listen<s%> to <S%H1697>lies<s%>, all his <S%H8334>servants<s%> are <S%H7563>wicked<s%>.
The <S%H7326>poor<s%> and the <S%H8501>deceitful<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> meet <S%H6298>together<s%>: the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> <S%H215>lightens<s%> <S%H8147>both<s%> their <S%H5869>eyes<s%>.
The <S%H4428>king<s%> that <S%H571>faithfully<s%> <S%H8199>judges<s%> the <S%H1800>poor<s%>, his <S%H3678>throne<s%> shall be <S%H3559>established<s%> for <S%H5703>ever<s%>.
The <S%H7626>rod<s%> and <S%H8433>reproof<s%> <S%H5414>give<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%>: but a <S%H5288>child<s%> <S%H7971>left<s%> to himself brings his <S%H517>mother<s%> to <S%H954>shame<s%>.
When the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> are <S%H7235>multiplied<s%>, <S%H6588>transgression<s%> <S%H7235>increases<s%>: but the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> shall <S%H7200>see<s%> their <S%H4658>fall<s%>.
<S%H3256>Correct<s%> your <S%H1121>son<s%>, and he shall give you <S%H5117>rest<s%>; <S%H5414>Yes<s%>, he shall give <S%H4574>delight<s%> unto your <S%H5315>soul<s%>.
Where there is no <S%H2377>vision<s%>, the <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H6544>perish<s%>: but he that <S%H8104>keeps<s%> the <S%H8451>law<s%>, happy is <S%H835>he<s%>.
A <S%H5650>servant<s%> will not be <S%H3256>corrected<s%> by <S%H1697>words<s%>: for though he <S%H995>understand<s%> he will not <S%H4617>answer<s%>.
<S%H2372>See<s%> you a <S%H376>man<s%> that is <S%H213>hasty<s%> in his <S%H1697>words<s%>? there is more <S%H8615>hope<s%> of a fool than of <S%H3684>him<s%>.
He that delicately brings <S%H6445>up<s%> his <S%H5650>servant<s%> from a <S%H5290>child<s%> shall have him become his <S%H4497>son<s%> at the <S%H319>length<s%>.
A <S%H639>angry<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> stirs <S%H1624>up<s%> <S%H4066>strife<s%>, and a <S%H2534>furious<s%> <S%H1167>man<s%> abounds <S%H7227>in<s%> <S%H6588>transgression<s%>.
A <S%H120>man<s%>'s <S%H1346>pride<s%> shall bring him <S%H8213>low<s%>: but <S%H3519>honor<s%> shall <S%H8551>uphold<s%> the <S%H8217>humble<s%> in <S%H7307>spirit<s%>.
Whoever is <S%H2505>partner<s%> with a <S%H1590>thief<s%> <S%H8130>hates<s%> his own <S%H5315>soul<s%>: he <S%H8085>hears<s%> <S%H423>cursing<s%>, and betrays it <S%H5046>not<s%>.
The <S%H2731>fear<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H5414>brings<s%> a <S%H4170>snare<s%>: but whoever puts his <S%H982>trust<s%> in the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> shall be <S%H7682>safe<s%>.
<S%H7227>Many<s%> <S%H1245>seek<s%> the <S%H4910>ruler<s%>'s <S%H6440>favor<s%>; but every <S%H376>man<s%>'s <S%H4941>judgment<s%> comes from the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>.

A <S%H5766>unjust<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> is a <S%H8441>abomination<s%> to the <S%H6662>just<s%>: and he that is <S%H3477>upright<s%> in the <S%H1870>way<s%> is <S%H8441>abomination<s%> to the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>.
